title: Update empty receipt section in the expense RHP

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
Coming from this conversation in [migrate](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07NMDKEFMH/p1767873619904629). **Problem:** We've seen many users manually uploading receipts (mostly PDFs) that could have been emailed to receipts@ and scanned/automatically matched with card transactions. **Solution:** Update the empty receipt section of the RHP to educate users on the different routes for adding receipts to Expensify:
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @DylanDylann

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.96-4 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-2734/folder/13176702/41236790/1113100202 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Regression TC Execution **Device used:** Honor x6b/ ANdorid 14, Win 10 / Chrome **App Component:** Chat Report View ## Action Performed: Precondition: WS collect with an Employee, who submitted a manuall expense for more than 100$ 1. Log in as the Admin 2. Navigate to the report that was submitted 3. Click on the report to view the details 4. Click the approve button 5. Verify that there is an empty state receipt placeholder without a Plus icon and not clickable Result: The Plus icon is shown and it is clickable ## Expected Result: After the report is approved, the receipt section should display an empty receipt placeholder without a Plus icon and should be non-clickable. ## Actual Result: After approving the report, the receipt section still displays a Plus icon that is clickable. The Admin is able to click the icon and upload a receipt, which then triggers a violation message "Receipt and expense addded details manually" ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/35c6ad35-f515-4196-9a4f-01e5a4242322 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] IOU - Pay with BA on participant's side leads to not here page, then option disappear in IOU

labels.name: External

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.96-4 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** Exploratory around https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-2733/folder/13177029/41237846/1113099870 & https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-2733/folder/13177029/41237847/1113099871 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** kiatest.80+ck18262@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Critical User Impact **Device used:** Windows 11/Chrome, iPhone 16/iOS 18.7.1 **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Prerequisites: 1. Create 2 new accounts User A (Creator) & User B (participant) with USD as a Payment currency 2. User A has created 2 IOU's with User B Steps: 1. Navigate to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Log in as User B (participant) 3. Navigate to IOU submitted by User A 4. Submit IOU to User A lesser than owed amount 5. Tap Pay button & observe Pay with Business account is not displayed 6. Log out & log in back as User B 7. Go to IOU report 8. Tap Pay button & observe Pay with Business account is displayed now 9. Select Pay with Business account 10. Observe Not here page opens 11. Navigate to IOU details page 12. Tap Pay button & observe Pay with BA option not displayed but the Pay button shows the workspace option 13. Navigate to IOU preview & tap Pay button 14. Observe Pay with BA option not displayed ## Expected Result: 1. If Pay with Business account is allowed while paying IOU, then on selecting that option should not lead to Not here page & no error should be displayed in workspace tab 2. Pay with BA option should always be displayed in both IOU preview & details page. It should not disappear when User B navigates to IOU details page while the Pay button shows option ## Actual Result: On step 6 - 10 : Pay with Business account option in IOU preview appears only after user B log out & log back in. Tapping on that option leads to Not here page & error displayed in workspace tab On step 11 - 14: On navigating to IOU details page, Pay with BA option is not displayed while the Pay button shows option. Only Pay with Personal account & Mark as Paid displayed in both IOU preview & details page ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/abb5dd0a-c74a-4403-aefa-a44fa49e3c5b [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.95-5 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** N/A **Issue reported by:** @trjExpensify **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): FS session ## Action Performed: 1. Create a _Control_ workspace 2. Go to Members > Invite member 3. Select a user > Next ## Expected Result: - Add the Approver row on the confirm details page. Set the entered user as the invitee's submitsTo. Notes: - The row should be populated by default with the workspace's default approver. - It should only appear on `Control` workspaces, because `Collect` workspaces use a single approver for all. - It should only appear when advanced approvals are enabled on the Control workspace, because basic approvals uses a single approver for all. - The members that appear in the select list should follow the same logic as exists in Workflows, no changes there. ## Actual Result: There isn't an Approver field as it stands. ## Workaround: N/A ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos In-line above. title: [$250] Add sticky filters to the reports page

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
Coming from https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07NMDKEFMH/p1767893350163039 We have three main queries for the reports page: - Expenses - Reports - Chats Each of these presets is currently a pre-defined query (IE `type:expense`, `type:expense-report`, etc), which we navigate to when the item is clicked. We want to make each of these presets have a sort of internal-state, allowing the user to navigate away from that preset, and then back to it, while preserving the selected filters. See the example below: - User clicks `Reports > Reports` - User filters by date, and user, while on the reports page - User clicks `Expenses` and gets taken to the expenses view - User changes some filters on the expenses page - User navigates back to the `Reports` Page - The filters on the reports page should be the same as before: date & user

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** **Reproducible in staging?:** N/A **Reproducible in production?:** N/A **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @ade-constantiniu **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [expensify_bugs]( https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1767865703941079) ## Action Performed: 1. Go to https://staging.new.expensify.com/ 2. Navigate to Account > Subscription ## Expected Result: This field exists in Old Expensify and allows customers to view and keep track of discount codes directly from the Subscription page. Surfacing this option in New Expensify would create parity with the old experience. **Important details:** - Once a code is validated and applied to the account, the user cannot edit it. They'll need to contact Concierge to do so. - Expensify Codes have a `Hide promo code from account settings?` setting. When this setting exists for a code applied to an account, we should hide the entire Expensify Code section from the user view. - If a user has a code associated already, we should show it in a non-editable state. UI mocks for where the code should live are [here](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/79087#issuecomment-3725539574). ## Actual Result: Not having it visible in New Expensify can be confusing for customers who already have a code or are expecting a place to enter one. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1b9cd1b5-75f5-4fbb-9d7c-7a17a49f88cf Check [OP](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1767865703941079) for the details.
